data.event: "York" class cruiser (Burns)
8,390 tons, 575' x 58' x 17'; 32 knots, complement 630; Armament 6 x 8", 4 x 4" A.A., 6 x 21" T.T. (triples); 2 aircraft; 2 catapults. (Burns)

event.title: EXETER arrived Devonport to commence leave period

data.event: (NH.n)
Ship’s Company on leave recalled and prepared to return to duty in South American Division of America and West Indies Squadron (NH.n)
Heavy cruiser EXETER departed Devonport for the South America Station via Freetown and Rio de Janiero (NH.n)

Heavy cruiser EXETER joined light cruisers COLOMBO and DAUNTLESS, escorting British liner DUNERA (11,162grt). Off Cape St Vincent on the 28th, EXETER was detached to proceed to Rio de Janiero, via Cape Verde Islands (NH.n)
Sailed from Freetown for passage to Rio de Janeiro (NH.n)
Took-up war station in South American Division of America and West Indies Squadron for deployment in South Atlantic for trade defence and the interception of German shipping (NH.n)
Rugby wireless transmission: "1100HRS: COMMENCE HOSTILITIES AT ONCE AGAINST GERMAN SHIPPING" (Gilbey)
Patrolled in area of Rio de Janeiro with HM Cruiser AJAX (NH.n)

event.title: EXETER on passage to River Plate

data.event: EXETER met HM Cruiser AJAX and made joint passage to Plate estuary (NH.n)
Escorted convoy from Plate estuary with HM Destroyer HOTSPUR (NH.n)
Deployed on patrol off Rio de Janeiro after call at Montevideo (NH.n)

event.title: EXETER makes passage to Falklands from patrol

data.event: Cdre Harwood transfers his flag to HMS AJAX (NH.n)

event.title: Patrol in Rio de Janiero area

data.event: (NH.n)

event.title: EXETER makes passage to Falklands from Rio patrol

data.event: Passage to Falklands via Plate area for search. (Note: Intended repair period in Simonstown cancelled.) Arrived 30 Nov at Port Stanley for self-refit (NH.n)

event.title: EXETER and AJAX at Port Stanley

data.event: (NH.n)

The Admiralty anticipated that the German pocket battleship might attack Port Stanley on the anniversary of the Falkland Island naval battle in which a British force under Vice Admiral Sir Doveton Sturdee defeated a German force under Vice Admiral Graf Maximilian von Spee on 8 December 1914 (NH.n)
EXETER left late that morning to escort Falkland Island Company ship LAFONIA (1961grt) to Rio de la Plata (NH.n)

Began passage to UK escorted for part of voyage by HM Cruisers DORSETSHIRE and SHROPSHIRE until relieved by HM Cruisers DEVONSHIRE and CUMBERLAND. Arrived at Plymouth for repair and modernisation including fit of aircraft warning radar (Type 279) and improved AA armament 15 Feb. (NH.n)

In position 200 miles east of Pernambuco the ARK ROYAL force RVed with the EXETER force. DORSETSHIRE and SHROPSHIRE then detached for Buenos Aires and Montevideo, respectively. The ARK ROYAL force escorting the EXETER set course for Freetown. (NH.n)
ARK ROYAL, RENOWN, EXETER, DAINTY and DIAMOND arrived at Freetown. Awaiting EXETER was the heavy repair ship RESOURCE and further repairs were carried out to EXETER (NH.n)
At 1800N ARK ROYAL, RENOWN, EXETER, DAINTY and DIAMOND sailed from Freetown and set course for Plymouth. (NH.n)

event.title: EXETER and RENOWN proceed to RV

data.event: At 1800N in position 23-30N, 21-20W, RENOWN and EXETER detached to proceed to rendezvous 'B' 48N, 13-30W. The destroyers DAINTY and DIAMOND were detached to Dakar to refuel. (NH.n)

ARK ROYAL, RENOWN and EXETER came under the command of the CinC Western Approaches for Operation VO. Operation VO was the interception of six German merchant ships which had departed Vigo on the night of the 9th/10th February. (NH.n)
ARK ROYAL, RENOWN and EXETER were joined by destroyers HASTY and HERO. ARK ROYAL’s Swordfish were involved in searching for the German steamers. (NH.n)
At 0900 hours in position 45N, 15W ARK ROYAL, RENOWN and EXETER were joined by destroyers ACASTA, WHITSHED and VESPER (NH.n)

event.title: EXETER and escorts evade German submarine patrol

data.event: From information gained by German naval intelligence, B-dienst, the Germans knew of the movements of the EXETER and were determined to prevent her returning to Britain. Dönitz was ordered to use U37 and U48 and Dönitz added U13 to set up a patrol line across the western end of the English Channel. However they failed to make contact with the returning EXETER or any of her escort (NH.n)
RENOWN, EXETER, cruiser GALATEA and destroyers ARDENT, HEARTY, WOLVERINE and WREN arrived at Plymouth. (NH.n)
